from pyspark.sql import functions as F, types as T
import uuid

def read_csv(path: str):
    return (spark.read.format("csv")
            .option("header", "true")
            .option("multiLine", "true")
            .option("quote", "\"")
            .option("escape", "\"")
            .option("mode", "PERMISSIVE")
            .load(path))

# Cases mapping file (your existing)
cases_map_path = "abfss://horizon-migration-poc@pinsstodwdevuks9h80mb.dfs.core.windows.net/config/Cases/Cases.csv"

# Pivoted involvement folder
involv_folder = "abfss://horizon-migration-poc@pinsstodwdevuks9h80mb.dfs.core.windows.net/MPESC-EXTRACT/LLAttr/Case_Involvement_95501/"

# Contacts extracts
person_path = "abfss://horizon-migration-poc@pinsstodwdevuks9h80mb.dfs.core.windows.net/MPESC-EXTRACT/Contacts_Person.csv"
org_path    = "abfss://horizon-migration-poc@pinsstodwdevuks9h80mb.dfs.core.windows.net/MPESC-EXTRACT/Contacts_Organisation.csv"

# Outputs
out_involv_contacts = "abfss://horizon-migration-poc@pinsstodwdevuks9h80mb.dfs.core.windows.net/MPESC-TRANSFORM/CaseInvolvement/CaseInvolvement_Contacts.csv"
out_addresses       = "abfss://horizon-migration-poc@pinsstodwdevuks9h80mb.dfs.core.windows.net/MPESC-TRANSFORM/Address/ContactAddress.csv"

involv_raw = read_csv(involv_folder)

print("involv_raw rows:", involv_raw.count())
print("involv_raw cols:", involv_raw.columns)
display(involv_raw.limit(10))

def nullify_undefined(expr):
    return F.when(F.trim(expr) == F.lit("undefined"), F.lit(None)).otherwise(expr)

involv = (involv_raw
    .withColumn("legacyCaseId", F.col("ID").cast("string"))
    .withColumn("legacyContactId", F.trim(F.col("20").cast("string")))   # KEEP as-is (incl P_0)
    .withColumn("typeOfInvolvement", F.trim(F.col("3").cast("string")))
    .withColumn("involvementStartDate", F.col("4").cast("string"))
    .withColumn("involvementEndDate", F.col("16").cast("string"))
    .withColumn("communicationPreference", F.col("17").cast("string"))
    .withColumn("externalReferenceNumber", F.col("18").cast("string"))
    .withColumn("contactDetails", F.col("19").cast("string"))
)

# Clean "undefined" strings -> null (but do not remove legacyContactId values like P_0 here)
involv = (involv
    .withColumn("legacyContactId", nullify_undefined(F.col("legacyContactId")))
    .withColumn("typeOfInvolvement", nullify_undefined(F.col("typeOfInvolvement")))
    .withColumn("involvementStartDate", nullify_undefined(F.col("involvementStartDate")))
    .withColumn("involvementEndDate", nullify_undefined(F.col("involvementEndDate")))
    .withColumn("communicationPreference", nullify_undefined(F.col("communicationPreference")))
    .withColumn("externalReferenceNumber", nullify_undefined(F.col("externalReferenceNumber")))
    .withColumn("contactDetails", nullify_undefined(F.col("contactDetails")))
    .withColumn("contactDetails",
        F.when(F.trim(F.col("contactDetails")) == F.lit("No Contact"), F.lit(None))
         .otherwise(F.col("contactDetails"))
    )
)

# Filter to only mapped cases (do NOT filter legacyContactId here)
involv_filtered = involv.join(cases_map, on="legacyCaseId", how="inner")

print("involv_filtered:", involv_filtered.count())
display(involv_filtered.limit(20))

people = (read_csv(person_path)
    .withColumn("legacyContactId", F.concat(F.lit("P_"), F.col("P_ID").cast("string")))
    .withColumn("contactSource", F.lit("person"))
    .withColumn("orgName", F.lit(None).cast("string"))
    .withColumn("firstName", F.trim(F.col("FirstName")))
    .withColumn("lastName",  F.trim(F.col("LastName")))
    .withColumn("email",     F.trim(F.col("Email")))
    .withColumn("telephoneNumber", F.coalesce(F.trim(F.col("TelephoneMobile")), F.trim(F.col("TelephoneOffice"))))
    .withColumn("poBox",        F.trim(F.col("POBox")))
    .withColumn("addressLine1", F.trim(F.col("Address1")))
    .withColumn("addressLine2", F.trim(F.col("Address2")))
    .withColumn("townCity",     F.trim(F.col("City")))
    .withColumn("county",       F.trim(F.col("County")))
    .withColumn("postcode",     F.trim(F.col("PostCode")))
    .withColumn("country",      F.trim(F.col("Country")))
    .select(
        "legacyContactId","contactSource","orgName","firstName","lastName",
        "telephoneNumber","email",
        "poBox","addressLine1","addressLine2","townCity","county","postcode","country"
    )
)

orgs = (read_csv(org_path)
    .withColumn("legacyContactId", F.concat(F.lit("O_"), F.col("ID").cast("string")))
    .withColumn("contactSource", F.lit("org"))
    .withColumn("orgName", F.trim(F.col("Name")))
    .withColumn("firstName", F.lit(None).cast("string"))
    .withColumn("lastName",  F.lit(None).cast("string"))
    .withColumn("email",     F.trim(F.col("Email")))
    .withColumn("telephoneNumber", F.trim(F.col("TelephoneOffice")))
    .withColumn("poBox",        F.trim(F.col("POBox")))
    .withColumn("addressLine1", F.trim(F.col("Address1")))
    .withColumn("addressLine2", F.trim(F.col("Address2")))
    .withColumn("townCity",     F.trim(F.col("City")))
    .withColumn("county",       F.trim(F.col("County")))
    .withColumn("postcode",     F.trim(F.col("PostCode")))
    .withColumn("country",      F.trim(F.col("Country")))
    .select(
        "legacyContactId","contactSource","orgName","firstName","lastName",
        "telephoneNumber","email",
        "poBox","addressLine1","addressLine2","townCity","county","postcode","country"
    )
)

contacts_dim = people.unionByName(orgs).dropDuplicates(["legacyContactId"])
print("contacts_dim:", contacts_dim.count())
display(contacts_dim.limit(20))

def norm_expr(e):
    return F.lower(F.trim(F.coalesce(e, F.lit(""))))

contacts_dim = (contacts_dim
    .withColumn("addressKey", F.concat_ws("|",
        norm_expr(F.col("poBox")),
        norm_expr(F.col("addressLine1")),
        norm_expr(F.col("addressLine2")),
        norm_expr(F.col("townCity")),
        norm_expr(F.col("county")),
        norm_expr(F.col("postcode")),
        norm_expr(F.col("country"))
    ))
    .withColumn("addressKey",
        F.when(F.col("addressKey") == F.lit("||||||"), F.lit(None)).otherwise(F.col("addressKey"))
    )
)

display(contacts_dim.select("legacyContactId","addressKey","postcode").limit(20))

# Build a contact -> addressId lookup (uses contacts_dim which DOES have addressKey)
contact_addr_lkp = (
    contacts_dim
      .select("legacyContactId", "addressKey")
      .join(addresses.select("addressKey", "addressId"), on="addressKey", how="left")
      .select("legacyContactId", "addressId")
)

# Attach addressId back to involvements using legacyContactId (present on left)
involv_final = involv_with_contacts.join(contact_addr_lkp, on="legacyContactId", how="left")

display(involv_final.limit(50))

(addresses.coalesce(1)
 .write.mode("overwrite")
 .option("header","true")
 .csv(out_addresses))
print("Wrote Address.csv:", out_addresses)

out = (involv_final
    .select(
        "caseId",
        "legacyCaseId",
        "legacyContactId",
        "typeOfInvolvement",
        "involvementStartDate",
        "involvementEndDate",
        "communicationPreference",
        "externalReferenceNumber",
        "contactDetails",
        "contactSource",
        "orgName",
        "firstName",
        "lastName",
        "email",
        "telephoneNumber",
        "addressId"
    )
)

(out.coalesce(1)
 .write.mode("overwrite")
 .option("header","true")
 .csv(out_involv_contacts))
print("Wrote CaseInvolvement_Contacts.csv:", out_involv_contacts)

print("missing contact matches:", involv_final.filter(F.col("contactSource").isNull()).count())
print("rows with null addressId:", involv_final.filter(F.col("addressId").isNull()).count())

display(involv_final
        .filter(F.col("contactSource").isNull())
        .select("legacyCaseId","caseId","legacyContactId","typeOfInvolvement","contactDetails")
        .limit(50))
